page.title: 01Area Surrounding Straiton
page.content: A mixed farming area of hills and small valleys. The village of Straiton is the focal point of the area. Sheep graze on the hills and moorland and are mainly of the black faced variety for production of wool. There are signs of afforestation being undertaken by the Forestry Commission on the outer limits of the block and a small administration centre is to be found in the village. Small pockets of deciduous and coniferous trees may be seen in the uncultivated areas. The picturesque village is popular with summer tourists and the day to day needs of the local community are served by only four commercial enterprises, namely a garage, general store, post office and small hotel. The two teacher primary school has a roll of 30.
